=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
This game is best described as a maze‐oriented action-puzzle game with arcade shooting elements. Here’s a breakdown of its characteristics and a suggested strategy:

Genre & Core Mechanics
• Action Puzzle/Maze: You must navigate a maze-like level with walls and obstacles while pursuing specific objectives.
• State Transformation: Your character exists in different states—a "nokey" state initially and, after retrieving a key, a "withkey" state. Transitioning between these is key (literally) to progress.
• Projectile/Sword Action: You have a shooting or “flicker” sword that can be used to defeat enemies. Enemies come in various speeds (quick, normal, and slow) and move randomly.
• Environmental Interactions: Some objects (like movable items, walls, and floor tiles) interact in simple ways (e.g., stepping back if you bump into a wall).

Objective & Win/Loss Conditions
• Main Objective: Your goal is to reach and “open” the door (goal) successfully. However, you can only use the door when you are in the “withkey” state—that is, after obtaining the key.
• Winning: The game is won when the door (goal sprite) is “used” by you carrying the key (withkey). The interaction “goal withkey > killSprite scoreChange=1” effectively removes the door, triggering the win.
• Losing: If your avatar is eliminated (e.g., by colliding with an enemy without proper defense), the game ends in a loss.

Detailed Mechanics
• Collecting the Key: Your avatar (which might be represented by a “nokey” state initially) can transform to "withkey" when it touches a key. This transformation not only increases your score but also enables you to successfully interact with the door.
• Combat: You can use your sword (via a flickering shooting mechanic) to defeat enemies. Kicking enemies with the sword adds points, whereas physical contact with enemies without using your weapon costs you points (and may lead to losing your avatar if not avoided).
• Enemies: They add danger as they patrol randomly at differing speeds and may disrupt your progress if you’re not cautious.

Overall Strategy
1. Plan Your Route: Start by exploring the maze to locate the key. Since you can’t use the door in your “nokey” state, getting the key first is essential.
2. Secure Yourself: As you navigate the corridors, keep an eye on the enemies. Plan paths that allow you to avoid or safely engage with them. If an enemy becomes a threat and is in your way, use your sword to dispatch it—remember that striking with the sword yields points.
3. Timing & Caution: Since some enemies are faster than others, learning their movement patterns can help you choose when to advance and when to hold back. Use your shooting action carefully, ensuring that you neutralize threats without unnecessarily putting yourself in danger.
4. Final Approach: Once you’ve picked up the key and transformed to “withkey,” head toward the door. Successfully colliding with the door in this state will eliminate the goal sprite and complete the level.
5. Keep an Eye on Scores: While the primary focus is on survival and objective completion, eliminating enemies effectively contributes to your score. However, avoid direct contact with an enemy if your sword isn’t deployed, as that results in score penalties (and potential loss of your avatar).

In summary, by navigating carefully through the maze, securing the key, and using your sword wisely to manage enemies, you’ll successfully reach and activate the door—winning the game.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
